title: Fred Longstaff
text:
Fred Longstaff (birth registered third ¼ 1890 – 22 July 1916) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s and 1910s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> and <a href="Yorkshire%20rugby%20league%20team">Yorkshire</a>, and at club level for <a href="Victoria%20Rangers%20A.R.L.F.C.">Victoria Rangers</a> <a href="Victoria%20Rangers%20ARLFC">ARLFC</a> (in <a href="Eccleshill%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Eccleshill</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a>), <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Halifax%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage № 166</a>) and <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>, as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a> (prior to the specialist positions of; ), during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s. He was a member of <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>'s 1914/15 'Team of All Talents' by winning <a href="All%20Four%20Cups">All Four Cups</a> available to them.
Background.
Fred Longstaff's birth was registered in <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> district, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England, and he died aged 25 on 22 July 1916, fighting at the <a href="Battle%20of%20the%20Somme">Battle of the Somme</a>, France. He served as a Private with the 1st/6th Bn. <a href="West%20Yorkshire%20Regiment%20%28Prince%20of%20Wales%27s%20Own%29">West Yorkshire Regiment (Prince of Wales's Own)</a>. He is buried at <a href="Blighty%20Valley%20Cemetery">Blighty Valley Cemetery</a>, <a href="Authuille%20Wood">Authuille Wood</a>.
Playing career.
International honours.
Fred Longstaff won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Huddersfield in 1914 against Wales, and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Huddersfield in 1914 against Australia, and New Zealand.
County honours.
Fred Longstaff played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 12, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in the "Possibles" 28-15 victory over the "Probables" in the <a href="Yorkshire%20rugby%20league%20team">Yorkshire</a> County Trial during the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1913–14 season</a> at <a href="Mount%20Pleasant%2C%20Batley">Mount Pleasent</a>, <a href="Batley">Batley</a> on Wednesday 1 October 1913, in front of a crowd of 2,000.
Fred Longstaff played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 13, in <a href="Yorkshire%20rugby%20league%20team">Yorkshire</a>'s 3-8 defeat by <a href="Cumberland%20rugby%20league%20team">Cumberland</a> in the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20County%20Championship">1913–14</a> <a href="County%20Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">County Championship</a> during the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1913–14 season</a> at <a href="Lonsdale%20Park">Lonsdale Park</a>, <a href="Workington">Workington</a> on Saturday 11 October 1913, in front of a crowd of 3,000, and played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 13, and scored 2-<a href="Goal%20%28sports%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>s in the 19-11 victory over <a href="Lancashire%20rugby%20league%20team">Lancashire</a> in the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20County%20Championship">1913–14</a> <a href="County%20Championship%20%28rugby%20league%29">County Championship</a> during the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1913–14 season</a> at <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Wednesday 10 December 1913, in front of a crowd of 3,500.
Championship Final appearances.
Longstaff played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 11, and scored a <a href="Goal%20%28sports%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a> in <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>'s 13-5 victory over <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship%20First%20Division">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1911%E2%80%9312%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Championship%20Play-Off">1911–12 season</a> at <a href="Thrum%20Hall">Thrum Hall</a>, <a href="Halifax%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Halifax</a> on Saturday 4 May 1912, in front of a crowd of 15,000, played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 13, in the 29-2 victory over <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship%20First%20Division">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1912%E2%80%9313%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Championship%20Play-Off">1912–13 season</a> at <a href="Belle%20Vue%20%28Wakefield%29">Belle Vue</a>, <a href="Wakefield">Wakefield</a> on Saturday 3 May 1913, in front of a crowd of 17,000, played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 8, in the 3-5 defeat by <a href="Salford%20Red%20Devils">Salford</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship%20First%20Division">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Championship%20Play-Off">1913–14 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 25 April 1914, in front of a crowd of 8,091, and played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 13, and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in the 35-2 victory over <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship%20First%20Division">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Championship%20Play-Off">1914–15 season</a> at <a href="Belle%20Vue%20%28Wakefield%29">Belle Vue</a>, <a href="Wakefield">Wakefield</a> on Saturday 24 April 1915, in front of a crowd of 14,000.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Longstaff played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 12, in <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>'s 9-5 victory over <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1912%E2%80%9313%20Challenge%20Cup">1912–13</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1912%E2%80%9313%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1912–13 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 26 April 1913, in front of a crowd of 22,754, and played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 13, in the 37-3 victory over <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in the <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Challenge%20Cup">1914–15</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1914–15 season</a> at <a href="Watersheddings">Watersheddings</a>, <a href="Oldham">Oldham</a> on Saturday 1 May 1915, in front of a crowd of 8,000.
County League appearances.
Fred Longstaff played in <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>'s victories in the <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20League">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1911%E2%80%9312%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1911–12 season</a>, <a href="1912%E2%80%9313%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1912–13 season</a>, <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1913–14 season</a> and <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1914–15 season</a>.
County Cup Final appearances.
Fred Longstaff played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 8, in <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>'s 19-3 victory over <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> in the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1913–14</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1913–14 season</a> at <a href="Thrum%20Hall">Thrum Hall</a>, <a href="Halifax%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Halifax</a> on Saturday 29 November 1913, in front of a crowd of 12,000, and played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 11, (the 2-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> that are occasionally misattributed to Fred Longstaff, were actually scored by <a href="Harold%20Wagstaff">Harold Wagstaff</a>) in the 31-0 victory over <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1914–15</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1914–15 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 28 November 1914, in front of a crowd of 12,000.
Club career.
Fred Longstaff transferred from <a href="Victoria%20Rangers%20A.R.L.F.C.">Victoria Rangers</a> <a href="Victoria%20Rangers%20ARLFC">ARLFC</a> to <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a>, he transferred from Halifax to <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a>, he made his début for Huddersfield in the 24-3 victory over Halifax at <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Saturday 23 December 1911, and he played his last match in the 37-3 victory over <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in the <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Challenge%20Cup">1914–15</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1914–15 season</a> at <a href="Watersheddings">Watersheddings</a>, <a href="Oldham">Oldham</a> on Saturday 1 May 1915, in front of a crowd of 8,000.
